newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's VEB sees autumn London Club close.
newsitem.headline: Russia's VEB sees autumn London Club close.

text.p: Russia expects to close agreement with the London Club of commercial bank creditors in autumn, Vneshekonombank (VEB) chairman Andrei Kostin said on Wednesday.
"I think the programme, which provides for autumn closing, is real," Kostin told a news conference. "We shall not have problems with keeping to the schedule."
"The signing of the documents between Vneshekonombank and members of the Bank Advisory Committee may take place either by the end of summer or early in autumn," Kostin said.
A senior Finance Ministry official said last week Russia would not be able to set the signing date for a rescheduling of the $35 billion debt before July 10.
He said Russia had reconciled 84 percent of the debt, while foreign banks had confirmed only 24 percent of the sum.
